In Syria, rights groups say the government has arrested at least 10,000 protesters in latest effort to crush the uprising.
Tornadoes rip through the northeastern United States killing four people.
In Yemen, government forces and fighters loyal to a tribal leader continue to exchange gunfire in Sanaa.
In Iraq, a bomb explodes at a wedding party killing 6 people in a village south of Baghdad.
In Chile, mounted police clash with students in the streets of Santiago over education reform.
Thai customs confiscate hundreds of endangered turtles and reptiles at the Bangkok airport.
